website_summaries.verdict: This harness is ideal for using with binoculars during hiking or hunting, given it holds them snug to the user’s body during physical activity.
pros: So comfortable that it’s easy to forget it’s even on when wearing for hours at a time
Harness makes it easy to wear binoculars snug against chest to ensure no swaying during physical activity
Elastic straps make it easy to take on and off
cons: May not be the ideal choice for large chested women

customer_reviews.title: These is a great harness for the price
customer_reviews.text: These is a great harness for the price. This is pretty comfortable. I was wearing it for over 8 hours a day for 6 days straight and did notice it. They good for wearing with a pack as they do not interfere. The short strings that are used to connect the binoculars to the harness both broke as they are EXTREMLY cheap. They broke on the 3rd day of use about an hour apart. Discard these as soon as you open the box and use real paracord.
customer_reviews.author: Rampage Maupin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I Have been using a cheap neck strap for years. I saw a guy wearing these and thought they looked dorky and bulky but after I finished a 5 hour mountain hike with them and my old, bulky pair of binocs I'll never go hiking again without them. They are so comfy that I forgot I had them on and sat down in the car before I realized they were still on. I guess I'll just look like a dork.
customer_reviews.author: Santafehunter

customer_reviews.title: NOT made for women!!
customer_reviews.text: My male friends like this because they can bend over or walk through brush and their binoculars stay put on their chest. But if you have any bosom at all, this will NOT be comfortable. Maybe they should say that in their description so women don't waste their money on it! It hadn't occurred to me that it would be so uncomfortable and I have a small bosom.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, works great for rangefinder.
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy to use. The wide back is nice for support and also makes it easy to put on. It keeps my rangefinder tucked up on my chest with plenty of clearance for shooting a bow. Not really "heavy" per se, but you feel it there...I wouldn't trade it for something that feels more flimsy just to loose a few ounces off the shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Coby Blum

customer_reviews.title: Go with a better style.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re between this product and the vortex style pouch you wear on your chest go with the pouch for the extra money. I figured I’d be fine with this, and i suppose I was but my lenses were constantly getting dirty and snowy, where as my hunting buddy with the pouch style always had clean binos ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great for lighter binoculars?
customer_reviews.text: So close to being great. Have the Bushnell 10x40 and as you walk around it slides lower and lower until it reaches max length. It is comfortable but needs more friction on the triglides. Would probably work on a lighter/smaller set of binoculars but not great for my 10x40.
customer_reviews.author: Chico

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I love this harness. It's comfortable and works great. I'm a big guy and it fits fine with room to go bigger. Only reason for 4 stars is because to attach it to the binoculars it came with just some nylon cord that you tie a knot onto the binoculars. Most harnesses and the neck strap that cape with my Bushnell binos a nice strap and plastic cinch to attach. The cord works ok but the strap would be much more secure and adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Kurdziels

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4yr old grandson. Took alot of searching. I was able to adjust the straps enough for him to wear with his binoculars. Still slightly big, but this one fits the best of all. Plus it covers enough of his back that it holds them in place better
customer_reviews.author: holly

customer_reviews.title: The big back disburses the weight of the binoculars much better than a previous harness I had that had a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used these twice while hunting. The big back disburses the weight of the binoculars much better than a previous harness I had that had a smaller back piece. The straps are elastic, which is nice while putting on/taking off. My only critique is that I find that the binoculars tend to slip lower. So you have to retighten the straps every once and a while.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: OK, but I think the straps could be a ...
customer_reviews.text: OK, but I think the straps could be a little more robust. I have a set of 8X and they are a little heavy for this.
customer_reviews.author: KevinH

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good way to save your neck
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to avoid carrying the binocs around the neck, and they work great. I was concerned they'd make my back sweaty, but these breathe great. Thanks, Bushnell!
customer_reviews.author: Erich R. Ebel

customer_reviews.title: Stretchy straps that fail
customer_reviews.text: Be aware this particular Bushnell product has all 4 straps made of stretch nylon. After a short while of use, they, like other similar binocular harness designs, stretch out of shape. Bushnell has straps available on Amazon that only use a small section of stretch material, albeit for more money. A much better investment, however.
customer_reviews.author: J Davis

customer_reviews.title: I expect better from a company - I shouldn't have to go ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction, but it doesn't even automatically fit to Bushnell binoculars. I bought with a pair of Bushnell Legend E Series, and when trying to attach, it's clear I need some rings to connect the binoculars to the plastic hooks on the harness (the plastic hooks do not fit the rings on the binoculars), but Bushnell includes no rings. Frustrating. I expect better from a company - I shouldn't have to go in search of workarounds to make Bushnell's own ancillary equipment work with their other products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adds to my quality of life and travel adventures
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for upcoming Alaska cruise to use with new binoculars. Had to also buy lanyards that fit small holes on side of binoculars that then attach to this harness. Great price and comfortable fit for big guy like me. Love Amazon for price value and convenience and adding to my quality of life.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Brachman

customer_reviews.title: A good harness for your camera and binoculars
customer_reviews.text: General: a camera/binocular harness created by some simple straps. It is a simple clever design that generally works well. Good: Simple strap design that works as it is supposed to. Comfortably carries a pair of binoculars or a camera securely. Bad: Not much. For holding binoculars it works perfectly, however if the straps are not adjusted to be long enough, the harness may tug on the camera when held in vertical mode, due to the straps being not quite long enough. Value: Good Price: $15 Quality: Good/fine. Seller: Amazon.com
customer_reviews.author: Kaunas8

customer_reviews.title: Good product but replace the string.
customer_reviews.text: First not been outdoors with as of yet but have attached my binoculars and woren. My only reservation is the cord used to attach is not coated so over time will need replaced but if like me already have 5/50 cord for that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Need a new harness. Say these on a bunch a hunting shows so tried it out. Very comfortable and easy to use and wear. Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Elkhunters

customer_reviews.title: Comfortably functional
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the functionality of this to glass on my hunts. Put it on for my morning walk and wondered if it would be comfortable or not. It worked very well. Looking forward to taking on my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable enough. The straps are sort of rough and ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable enough. The straps are sort of rough and the clips that connect to the harness that hold the binoculars make some noise when you raise the glasses up to look. Its not a huge amount of noise obviously but its something. Maybe I'm too picky but I want it to be silent and smooth and not feel sort of friction/catchy on the webbing/straps as I use these for hunting whitetail. These are comfortable and I'm sorting out a method to attach binos silently.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Leighton

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Cos we're too big for my binos but i made them work. Very comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.author: Tim. P.

customer_reviews.title: Universal to other bino’s, and Much better than a neck harness
customer_reviews.text: While wearing this harness you can’t even tell it’s there. It’s very adjustable and it’s universal to other binoculars, not just bushnell. Plus it’s a great value! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adequate/good potential.
customer_reviews.text: I wear it upside down so I get the widest possible fit over my shoulders to prevent any neck pull. It does pull down in front too much with the weight of my light weight binocs but am still working on customizing the straps and attaching points.
customer_reviews.author: Lin F.

customer_reviews.title: Bushnell Deluxe binocular harness
customer_reviews.text: Veey nice way to carry your binoculars. Comfortable and adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: 82tcool

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Can't beat this harness for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Can't beat this harness for the price. Only complaints are that it smells like rubber and feels a tad on the cheap side but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: jake priest

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, smooth action, arrived in 1 day with prime!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Comfortable, lightweight and smooth movement. For any price (aside from the case style) I haven't seen one better. They sit well and make it easy to hike into he backcountry while having your knockers ready at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Shobagz

customer_reviews.title: No neck pain!
customer_reviews.text: Takes the burden off your neck and free your hands from holding them still.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Clips won't attach to Bushnell Legend Ultra HD 10x 42mm ...
customer_reviews.text: Clips won't attach to Bushnell Legend Ultra HD 10x 42mm Roof Prism Binocular due to recessed loops on the binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Sedwin

customer_reviews.title: These ones don't have the easy hook key rings
customer_reviews.text: These ones don't have the easy hook key rings, like most other harnesses (just a cheap piece of nylon string),but the clips are the same if you just find similar rings at the hardware store. The back on these is nicer and distributes the weight a bit more evenly than standard bono harnesses, making them slightly more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bino harness
customer_reviews.text: I really like this harness. It was a lot cheaper than many other brands, but stacks up well. I love having my Vortex diamondbacks right there when I need them while being secured when I don't. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: All Things Man

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift. Wish I had one myself.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Schremmer

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't fit Celestron binoculars
customer_reviews.text: There are no instructions/directions for this device, the assumption being that they're SO easy to use, you don't need our help! And I tore up the plastic vault it was shipped in, so I can't return them! Great!
customer_reviews.author: D. G. Guido

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This harness makes wearing heavy binoculars comfortable. It spreads the weight on your back so you hardly feel that you're carrying binoculars. The harness stays in place, so no more constant pulling straps down your back as I did with my previous harness which didn't have such a large "pad". The elasticized straps in front allow the binoculars to be brought up to your eyes easily. I spend hours at a time birding and this harness has made a big difference in the comfort of my neck and shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: hsuzyq

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hunting
customer_reviews.text: Great product. This harness has been worth its weight in gold. The fact that I have gone this long without it upsets me.
customer_reviews.author: BrettS

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Works great just can't keep it from sliding down causing slack in the straps simple tape fixed it
customer_reviews.author: brandon cilman

customer_reviews.title: Nice for comfort and quick access.
customer_reviews.text: I just spent 4 days hunting with this harness in use. It is very comfortable and good to have on long walks. It is made of very lightweight material. I don't know how it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: comfortable, took a black marker to the bright white bushnell advertisement on the front
customer_reviews.author: Reed Maddray

customer_reviews.title: ... larger pair of Bino's and it didn't even feel like they were on my chest a couple of times ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this hunting in the hills of eastern Washington and it held them snug against the chest I was able to use my larger pair of Bino's and it didn't even feel like they were on my chest a couple of times I had to remind myself that they were at arms reach when looking off in the distance.
customer_reviews.author: matthew gilroy

customer_reviews.title: Have never used one of these before but have frequently ...
customer_reviews.text: Have never used one of these before but have frequently suffered neck pain while carrying binoculars with their around the neck straps. This harness relieves all that neck pressure while keeping the glasses at the ready.
customer_reviews.author: Solvravnen

customer_reviews.title: Great harness!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, they work great. I forget I'm wearing it, it's that comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Anders

customer_reviews.title: Nice harness. It feels comfortable while wearing and eliminates ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice harness. It feels comfortable while wearing and eliminates neck strain when compared to a neck strap. The only complaint that I have is that the clips were too large to fit my Bushnell Bear Grylls binoculars, so I had to improvise with string. I would have thought that they would be compatible, but they are not.
customer_reviews.author: TK17472

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It works. It rides up a bit in the back, but not uncomfortably. The elastic straps look like they will wear out pretty quickly, but then, it wasn't much money.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: takes the burden off your neck!
customer_reviews.text: Traipsing through the woods with binoculars and/or camera around my neck always left me sore. But....put those lovely wildlife watching helpers on this little harness and it takes the weight. Can't recommend this enough! Attach binocs or camera and----no neck pain. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: TouchingPaws

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was not happy with this harness. It did not appear to be secure. My concern is with the clips to remove the binoculars from the harness. I have returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: KMF

customer_reviews.title: If your gonna bring a set of binoculars with you ...
customer_reviews.text: If your gonna bring a set of binoculars with you this is a must... no more hanging from your neck and flopping around
customer_reviews.author: Greenie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable way to carry binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Functions as expected. Great for adventures and hunting. Decently comfortable even under backpack straps.
customer_reviews.author: Idlewild and Sage

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, ease to use!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly comfortable with my Bushnell Legend Ultra binoculars attached. The binoculars remain close to the body, limited swinging, pick them up and have full range of motion with a four inch strap I attached to my binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: Got exactly what I was expecting, keeps my binoculars nice and tight to my chest so they aren't swinging around and getting in the way of my bow. I can also wear them for long periods without them bothering my neck.
customer_reviews.author: Phil C.

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this harness I ditch my big bono harness/ case and only use this 75% of the time even if I’m using my bigger harness I use this one too
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: ... one for my husband after I got mine he liked it better than the one he was using
customer_reviews.text: Bought a second one for my husband after I got mine he liked it better than the one he was using.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Moss

customer_reviews.title: Love it, I have tried several different types from ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I have tried several different types from the more expensive to the least expensive. This harness is the one I like the most. Very light weight and not at all bulky. Keeps my Binos secure and comfortable right were I want them and still out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: SGB

customer_reviews.title: The size
customer_reviews.text: Works for binoculars and fits who it is used for
customer_reviews.author: Bus Driver

customer_reviews.title: The harness is the most comfortable of any that I have tried and provides the ...
customer_reviews.text: I use the harness with my Bushnell Legend Ulta HD 8 x 42 Binocular for birding. The harness is the most comfortable of any that I have tried and provides the quick to the eye access that is needed for birding
customer_reviews.author: pmb

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I just had to rig my binoculars because they didn't have the holes built into the frame like most do. But the harness works great
customer_reviews.author: B. N.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This unit really takes the weight of the Bino's off the neck. I wear y Bino's all day with ease with this harness.
customer_reviews.author: joseph Webster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loved this gift, works better than his last binocular strap.
customer_reviews.author: Sounya

customer_reviews.title: Good enough....
customer_reviews.text: Never know if these should be worn outside the jacket or underneath. They do hold binoculars close to your body so they serve the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: David M Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good buy
customer_reviews.text: Good product definitely makes for easier hands free use of my bushnell binoculars and it's easier to keep my binos on my person in a more comfortable manner.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good bino harness
customer_reviews.text: Good for what I need them for will be interesting to see how they hold up over time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. Just make sure you click the across the chest strap on your daypack underneath the two straps of this one. This harness makes it so I don't even notice my Leupold Yosemite 8x30 BX-1.
customer_reviews.author: TheGDog

customer_reviews.title: Almost Great
customer_reviews.text: I really like the concept and it works fine, but the stitching on the big "B" in middle started falling out almost immediately, which makes me wonder.
customer_reviews.author: ClubOfRome

customer_reviews.title: The Only Way To Carry Binoculars
customer_reviews.text: With this harness tired sore neck muscles from packing around heavy binoculars are a thing of the past. The Bushnell Deluxe Binocular Harness moves the weight from your neck to your back and shoulders and spreads it evenly. The result is comfort and less fatigue and I've equipped all of my binoculars with these.
customer_reviews.author: DangFineGuy

customer_reviews.title: and a great price. It does seem to make me sweat ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, strong clips, and a great price. It does seem to make me sweat more on my shoulders, but thats to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable way to wear your Bushnell binoculars they fit mine perfectly and I look forward to using them in the mountains
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product and is easy to use and attach my ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and is easy to use and attach my binoculars. My only complaint is that after wearing this all day out hiking and riding ATV's is seemed that the straps were stretching a little and my binoculars weren't being held up where I wanted them to be. Overall still a great product and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Adams

customer_reviews.title: Like them
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but I wish there was a stop on the straps to stop the binoculars from sliding down.
customer_reviews.author: Austin S

customer_reviews.title: Product is useful and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This product is useful and comfortable to wear. It is great for gun hunts, scouting, etc. I do not recommend it for bow hunting, because the binoculars sit so high that they obstruct the bow string. I was disappointed that they would not readily attach to my Bushnell binoculars. I had to insert rings into the lanyard holes in the binoculars in order to attach the harness. Works good.
customer_reviews.author: HuntAllGame

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works great on the Bushnell Trophy binoculars I just purchased. I forget they are even hanging there even though those binoculars weigh over a pound (I think).
customer_reviews.author: thomas Harders

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and functional
customer_reviews.text: This harness does a great job of keeping the weight of the binoculars distributed comfortably, and prevents them from swinging or bouncing when I walk. It doesn't restrict me at all when I raise the binoculars to my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K

customer_reviews.title: Fit great! Distribute weight very well
customer_reviews.text: Fit great! Distribute weight very well. Once you get used to using them, you will never want to use binoculars without them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: was kind of tight, also clips were too thick for my binos.
customer_reviews.author: Kostik

customer_reviews.title: Makes hiking with my Binoculars much better.
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Makes hiking with my Binoculars much better.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Christian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: does a great job of taking the weight of binos off the neck
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Overall not bad, but the back piece constantly rides up to ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall not bad, but the back piece constantly rides up to my shoulders and has to be pulled back down.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: It would be nice if they had clips that you could position the ...
customer_reviews.text: Tend to ride up the to the back of my neck when hiking and it holds the binoculars to low. It would be nice if they had clips that you could position the binoculars but then I suppose that would make the neck issue even worse. Worked pretty well for the hunting season but no better then the standard harness.
customer_reviews.author: Kyla

customer_reviews.title: so it must be good. And I like the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband to use while hunting. Haven't heard any complaints from him, so it must be good. And I like the price. Does the job for lots less than other similar products.
customer_reviews.author: George D Clark

customer_reviews.title: Where you been all my life!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely fantastic! Comfortable and convenient, if you hunt these are a necessity.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Ted

customer_reviews.title: Best Binocular Harness
customer_reviews.text: As a hardcore birder this is the best harness I have ever owned, I am on my second one now. as with most the elastic stretches and doesn't pop back after a while.
customer_reviews.author: gallus quigley

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have this!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the harness. I have never worn one for binoculars before. It is very comfortable. I would highly recommend. The price is good too!
customer_reviews.author: dlv

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice way of keeping your bino's ready but out of the way. I purchased one for myself and one for my Dad - we are both avid hunters. I love having this while hunting and find myself wishing I had it when I opted to leave it at home. It's adjustable so you can keep the bino's in a specific spot. I shoot a bow from a treestand and was worried about whether or not this would let my bino's hang and interfere with the string release, but it does not. It keeps the bino's tightly up against your body, unless you need them. Great product. You wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DntBrnDPig

customer_reviews.title: Very nice but clips ar very large
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice quality harness which works well. My only hang-up would be the plastic clips which are very large and bulky so I had to add an additional ring to my binoculars mount so that I could attach the clips. If the clips were smaller and perhaps made of metal, I think I would have been able to clip them directly to the sling mounting points on my binocular. Otherwise this is a nice product which appears to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great product and price
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and allows you to position the binoculars high on the chest and they do not slip like most other harnesses. The best I have had for birding and the least expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Homeroid

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: I am using this harness with Nikon's 7x50 Action ATB binoculars; they are fairly substantial. Two poor design features reduced my rating of this product: For the aforementioned binocs, the elastic straps are too weak allowing the binocs to creep too low on my body even with max adjustment to the straps. Secondly, without going into too much detail, the attachment hardware is cheap and a pain to use. However, once attached (ignoring the fact that the binocs sag low) the harness does its job. This product will probably perform well with smaller optics, but the attachment hardware will annoy you.
customer_reviews.author: D. Saad

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: This product is a joke. It says it fits "most" binoculars yet the clips on it won't even fit their own Bushnell powerview binoculars I just bought. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie F.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: will be nice when I figure out how to put it on and hook up my binos...LOL...
customer_reviews.author: Mark Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: Bought this last year to test and it worked so ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last year to test and it worked so well my wife took it for her bins so I ordered another one.
customer_reviews.author: D Hall

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color
customer_reviews.text: Works good but the description says black and received a gray one
customer_reviews.author: zachary hecht

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, takes a few minutes to get it set up for the right fit
customer_reviews.author: G$$

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the money, received in a timely manner
customer_reviews.author: Sharp shooter

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for keeping your binos off your neck. I wanted something that kept the weight of the binos off my neck, kept them from flopping around and was easy to use, this was perfect. I used zip ties to attach them to the harness since my binoculars didn't have a big enough hole for the clips to clip into.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The harness is good and helps to relieve the pressure of the binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Johnson

customer_reviews.title: You will enjoy your binoculars much more with this
customer_reviews.text: All binoculars should come with this. You will enjoy your binoculars much more with this.
customer_reviews.author: Rere B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what you need if you are going to be hiking around! Fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and functional!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, functional. Doesn't bind up or catch on gear like other elastic strapped bino harnesses. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Swim Dad

customer_reviews.title: exclent 4 any sportsmen or sports fan.
customer_reviews.text: i.am going 2 enjoy this product.this product will make the use of new bushnell binocular use more enjoyable watching birds.recomed this product 2 any hunter birder or sportsman.over all gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerStuart

customer_reviews.title: Easy to attach to binoculars
customer_reviews.text: Met my expectations. Fits well and way to adjust. Easy to attach to binoculars.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dearth

customer_reviews.title: Well worth buying ;
customer_reviews.text: Goes great with the Bone Collector Binoculars.Really comfortable and keeps glasses out of the way but keeps them right there at the ready.
customer_reviews.author: Harleyrider

customer_reviews.title: A Great Harness
customer_reviews.text: Not much I can say other than it is well made, easy to adjust, and fits comfortably. I am a pretty good sized guy, and I have no problem with the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Timecow

customer_reviews.title: He was very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a Christmas present for my son. He was very pleased with it. I think it was just what he wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Stalnaker

customer_reviews.title: Thank me later
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable way the carry binoculars for long periods of time. Get one! You'll thank me later?
customer_reviews.author: justsayj

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great even if you are a big man like myself. 6'3" 385 and has plenty of room
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Bushnell BinoculAR Accessory 19125C Deluxe Bino HARness Black Clam
product_meta.description:
A carry solution of unparallelled comfort and performance. Our new deluxe bino harness keeps the weight off your neck and keeps your optics front and center no matter where the hunt takes you.

AMAZON.COM
Take the pressure off while wearing your binoculars with this Bushnell deluxe harness. Equipped with elastic straps, the harness positions your binocular, rangefinder, or light camera comfortably upon your chest even while riding a horse or engaging in another bouncy activity. As a result, you'll disperse the weight of your electronic device onto your shoulders and torso rather than restricting it to your neck, making it far more comfortable to hold for long periods. When perfectly positioned, your optics will rest just below your chin, so you can sight an object in an instant. 

 This deluxe version of the Bushnell harness has a wide, perforated panel for your back, helping it support heavy binoculars with large, heavy objective lenses. 

 About Bushnell
Bushnell has been the industry leader in high-performance sports optics for more than 50 years. The company's guiding principle is to provide the highest quality, most reliable, and most affordable sports optics products on the market. Bushnell product lines enhance the enjoyment of every outdoor pursuit, including nature study, hunting, fishing, birding, and stargazing. Indoors, the company's binoculars bring the audience closer to the action in fast-moving sports or the fine arts at theaters and concerts.
feature_bullets: A carry solution of unparallelled comfort and performance
Deluxe harness for binoculars, rangefinders, or light cameras
Elastic straps position harness comfortably on your chest
Disperses weight of device on shoulders and torso
Optics rest below chin for easy, quick sighting
Wide, perforated back panel supports heavy binoculars
